text: Maurice Gwynn was a Welsh Anglican priest in the 17th century."An History of the Mitred Parliamentary Abbies, and Conventual Cathedral Churches" Bowyer, W. p343: London; Robert Gosling; 1719 Gwynn was educated at University College, Oxford.Alumni Oxonienses 1500-1714, Gilpin-Greenhaugh He held livings at Trawsfynydd, Llanfwrog and Llantrissaint. Gwynn was Archdeacon of Bangor from 1613 until his death on 9 September 1617."Fasti Ecclesiæ Anglicanæ from the First Erection Thereof to this Present Year 1715" p29: London; J.Nutt; 1716 ==References== Category:Alumni of University College, Oxford Category:Archdeacons of Bangor Category:17th-century Welsh people
title: Richard Gwynn
